awd_titl_txt: The Role of Fast Atmospheric Teleconnections in Extended    Global Weather Predicition
awd_abstract_narration: This is a study to investigate the transmission of errors by               the teleconnection processes in the atmosphere.  The project                    consists of three parts, (a) to use the DERF dataset for testing                the hypothesis that the location of maximum response to tropical                forcing is "phase locked", (b) to examine the response of a                     simplified NMC GCM to a variety of tropical forcing scenarios,                  and (c) to investigate the response of the NMC operational GCM to               tropical forcing.                                                                    This project is important because it will help to clarify a                potentially significant source of uncertainty in the present                    meteorological operational data analyses.  In addition the study                will benefit the ongoing efforts for designing more effective                   observational platforms and networks.
org_div_long_name: Division of Atmospheric and Geospace Sciences
